trans-unit.source: Step 3: Create Agreements Between Partner Profiles
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Create Agreements Between Partner Profiles

trans-unit.source: In this step, you create an agreement between the profiles of the two trading partners, Northwind and Contoso.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you create an agreement between the profiles of the two trading partners, Northwind and Contoso.

trans-unit.source: To specify the General Settings of an X12 agreement
trans-unit.target: To specify the General Settings of an X12 agreement

trans-unit.source: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Agreements</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Agreements</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Agreements</embeddedLabel> page, click the <ui>X12</ui> tab if you are not already on that tab.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Agreements</embeddedLabel> page, click the <ui>X12</ui> tab if you are not already on that tab.

trans-unit.source: Then click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Then click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>New Agreement</ui> page, enter the following details:
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>New Agreement</ui> page, enter the following details:

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, specify the name as <userInput>NorthwindContosoX12</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, specify the name as <userInput>NorthwindContosoX12</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: This is a mandatory field.
trans-unit.target: This is a mandatory field.

trans-unit.source: The name for the agreement must be unique.
trans-unit.target: The name for the agreement must be unique.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Enter notes or a description for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Enter notes or a description for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Hosted Partner
trans-unit.target: Hosted Partner

trans-unit.source: Select the hosted partner for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Select the hosted partner for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: A hosted partner is a partner managed by the service provider and the pipelines are deployed for that partner during agreement deployment.
trans-unit.target: A hosted partner is a partner managed by the service provider and the pipelines are deployed for that partner during agreement deployment.

trans-unit.source: Typically partners managed by service provider are configured as a hosted partner while the enterprise partners are guest partners.
trans-unit.target: Typically partners managed by service provider are configured as a hosted partner while the enterprise partners are guest partners.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, the hosted partner is <embeddedLabel>Northwind</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, the hosted partner is <embeddedLabel>Northwind</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The default profile for Northwind is displayed in the <embeddedLabel>Profile</embeddedLabel> field.
trans-unit.target: The default profile for Northwind is displayed in the <embeddedLabel>Profile</embeddedLabel> field.

trans-unit.source: Guest Partner
trans-unit.target: Guest Partner

trans-unit.source: Select the partner for the agreement (who is not a hosted partner).
trans-unit.target: Select the partner for the agreement (who is not a hosted partner).

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>Contoso</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>Contoso</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The default profile for Contoso is displayed in the <embeddedLabel>Profile</embeddedLabel> field.
trans-unit.target: The default profile for Contoso is displayed in the <embeddedLabel>Profile</embeddedLabel> field.

trans-unit.source: Identities
trans-unit.target: Identities

trans-unit.source: Hosted Partner ID Qualifier
trans-unit.target: Hosted Partner ID Qualifier

trans-unit.source: Select an authenticating qualifier that provides unique business identities to the trading partners.
trans-unit.target: Select an authenticating qualifier that provides unique business identities to the trading partners.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>ZZ-Mutually Defined</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>ZZ-Mutually Defined</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInput>US</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInput>US</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Guest Partner ID Qualifier
trans-unit.target: Guest Partner ID Qualifier

trans-unit.source: Select an authenticating qualifier that provides unique business identities to the trading partners.
trans-unit.target: Select an authenticating qualifier that provides unique business identities to the trading partners.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>ZZ-Mutually Defined</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>ZZ-Mutually Defined</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInput>THEM</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInput>THEM</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Tracking
trans-unit.target: Tracking

trans-unit.source: Track Send side message properties
trans-unit.target: Track Send side message properties

trans-unit.source: Check this to store the message properties when the EDI message is sent to the partner.
trans-unit.target: Check this to store the message properties when the EDI message is sent to the partner.

trans-unit.source: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.
trans-unit.target: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.

trans-unit.source: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Archive Send side message</ui>.
trans-unit.target: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Archive Send side message</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Track Receive side message properties
trans-unit.target: Track Receive side message properties

trans-unit.source: Check this to store the message properties when the EDI message is received from a partner.
trans-unit.target: Check this to store the message properties when the EDI message is received from a partner.

trans-unit.source: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.
trans-unit.target: Once stored, you can query this data by clicking <embeddedLabel>Tracking</embeddedLabel> on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page.

trans-unit.source: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Archive Receive side message</ui>.
trans-unit.target: When enabled, you can also store the message body by checking <ui>Archive Receive side message</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Continue</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Continue</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Clicking <embeddedLabel>Continue</embeddedLabel> adds two new tabs, one for receive settings and the other for send settings.
trans-unit.target: Clicking <embeddedLabel>Continue</embeddedLabel> adds two new tabs, one for receive settings and the other for send settings.

trans-unit.source: Each tab is for a one-way agreement between the two partners, one for receiving messages and the other for sending messages.
trans-unit.target: Each tab is for a one-way agreement between the two partners, one for receiving messages and the other for sending messages.

trans-unit.source: The properties in the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab define how the EDI receive bridge is configured.
trans-unit.target: The properties in the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab define how the EDI receive bridge is configured.

trans-unit.source: This bridge receives incoming EDI messages that are sent to Northwind.
trans-unit.target: This bridge receives incoming EDI messages that are sent to Northwind.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, the properties in the <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab define how the EDI send bridge is configured.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, the properties in the <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab define how the EDI send bridge is configured.

trans-unit.source: This bridge sends EDI messages from Northwind to its trading partners like Contoso.
trans-unit.target: This bridge sends EDI messages from Northwind to its trading partners like Contoso.

trans-unit.source: To specify the receive settings
trans-unit.target: To specify the receive settings

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> page, set the <embeddedLabel>Transport type</embeddedLabel> to HTTP.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> page, set the <embeddedLabel>Transport type</embeddedLabel> to HTTP.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel> page, specify the following values.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel> page, specify the following values.

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Acknowledgements</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>TA1 expected</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>997 expected</embeddedLabel> to receive acknowledgements from the partner receiving the message.
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Acknowledgements</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>TA1 expected</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>997 expected</embeddedLabel> to receive acknowledgements from the partner receiving the message.

trans-unit.source: Under the <embeddedLabel>Schemas</embeddedLabel> section, set the following properties.
trans-unit.target: Under the <embeddedLabel>Schemas</embeddedLabel> section, set the following properties.

trans-unit.source: Version
trans-unit.target: Version

trans-unit.source: Transaction Type (ST1)
trans-unit.target: Transaction Type (ST1)

trans-unit.source: Sender Application (GS2)
trans-unit.target: Sender Application (GS2)

trans-unit.source: THEM
trans-unit.target: THEM

trans-unit.source: Schema
trans-unit.target: Schema

trans-unit.source: You do not need to explicitly upload the artifacts (schemas or transforms) to the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: You do not need to explicitly upload the artifacts (schemas or transforms) to the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>EAIEDITutorial</embeddedLabel> <token>msgflow_proj</token> you created earlier already includes the artifacts.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>EAIEDITutorial</embeddedLabel> <token>msgflow_proj</token> you created earlier already includes the artifacts.

trans-unit.source: So, deploying the project also uploads the artifacts under the <token>af_integration</token> subscription.
trans-unit.target: So, deploying the project also uploads the artifacts under the <token>af_integration</token> subscription.

trans-unit.source: Because you registered with the <token>tpm_portal</token> using the same <token>af_integration</token> subscription, the artifacts are also available from the portal.
trans-unit.target: Because you registered with the <token>tpm_portal</token> using the same <token>af_integration</token> subscription, the artifacts are also available from the portal.

trans-unit.source: You can view the schemas and transforms from the <embeddedLabel>Resources</embeddedLabel> tab of the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can view the schemas and transforms from the <embeddedLabel>Resources</embeddedLabel> tab of the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: On the Transform page, click the plus sign to add a new row.
trans-unit.target: On the Transform page, click the plus sign to add a new row.

trans-unit.source: From the drop-down, choose <embeddedLabel>/X12_00401_840.xsd</embeddedLabel> for <embeddedLabel>Schemas</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>/EDI840ToSalesOrder.trfm</embeddedLabel> for <embeddedLabel>Transform file name</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: From the drop-down, choose <embeddedLabel>/X12_00401_840.xsd</embeddedLabel> for <embeddedLabel>Schemas</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>/EDI840ToSalesOrder.trfm</embeddedLabel> for <embeddedLabel>Transform file name</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Route</embeddedLabel> page, click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to add a route destination.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Route</embeddedLabel> page, click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to add a route destination.

trans-unit.source: Set the <embeddedLabel>Rule Name</embeddedLabel> to <userInput>SendToBridge</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Set the <embeddedLabel>Rule Name</embeddedLabel> to <userInput>SendToBridge</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Route rule</embeddedLabel>, select the <embeddedLabel>Use advanced definitions</embeddedLabel> option and specify the following expression in the text box:
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Route rule</embeddedLabel>, select the <embeddedLabel>Use advanced definitions</embeddedLabel> option and specify the following expression in the text box:

trans-unit.source: This expression always resolves to true, which means that all the messages are routed to the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: This expression always resolves to true, which means that all the messages are routed to the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: Even if you do not select the <embeddedLabel>Use advanced definitions</embeddedLabel> option and do not provide any route rule, by default this option is selected and its value is set to <embeddedLabel>1=1</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Even if you do not select the <embeddedLabel>Use advanced definitions</embeddedLabel> option and do not provide any route rule, by default this option is selected and its value is set to <embeddedLabel>1=1</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: This means that the default behavior is to route all the messages to the route destination.
trans-unit.target: This means that the default behavior is to route all the messages to the route destination.

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Route action</embeddedLabel>, click the plus sign to add a new row and set the following values:
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Route action</embeddedLabel>, click the plus sign to add a new row and set the following values:

trans-unit.source: Set <embeddedLabel>Target Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Http Header</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: Set <embeddedLabel>Target Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Http Header</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Set <embeddedLabel>Header Name</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Content-Type</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: Set <embeddedLabel>Header Name</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Content-Type</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Set <embeddedLabel>Value Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Constant</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: Set <embeddedLabel>Value Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Constant</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Set <embeddedLabel>Constant Value</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>application/xml</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: Set <embeddedLabel>Constant Value</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>application/xml</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: This ensures that all the messages that are routed to the <token>bridge</token> include a <embeddedLabel>content-type</embeddedLabel> header with its value set to <embeddedLabel>application/xml</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that all the messages that are routed to the <token>bridge</token> include a <embeddedLabel>content-type</embeddedLabel> header with its value set to <embeddedLabel>application/xml</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Without this header, the bridge receiving the message treats it as a flat-file message and might result in validation errors.
trans-unit.target: Without this header, the bridge receiving the message treats it as a flat-file message and might result in validation errors.

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Route destination</embeddedLabel>, set <embeddedLabel>Transport type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Azure BizTalk Bridge</embeddedLabel> and in the text box enter the entity name of the bridge on the message flow surface.
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Route destination</embeddedLabel>, set <embeddedLabel>Transport type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Azure BizTalk Bridge</embeddedLabel> and in the text box enter the entity name of the bridge on the message flow surface.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, the entity name is the default name, which is <embeddedLabel>XmlRequestReplyBridge1</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, the entity name is the default name, which is <embeddedLabel>XmlRequestReplyBridge1</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Using this name the bridge deployment endpoint is built, which is <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>mybiztalkservicename</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/<codeFeaturedElement>XmlRequestReplyBridge1</codeFeaturedElement></codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Using this name the bridge deployment endpoint is built, which is <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>mybiztalkservicename</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/<codeFeaturedElement>XmlRequestReplyBridge1</codeFeaturedElement></codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: With this configuration, all the messages processed by the agreement are routed to the <token>request_response</token> bridge you deployed earlier.
trans-unit.target: With this configuration, all the messages processed by the agreement are routed to the <token>request_response</token> bridge you deployed earlier.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Route</embeddedLabel> page, Under <embeddedLabel>Message Suspension Settings</embeddedLabel>, specify an endpoint where any messages that fail processing are sent to.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Route</embeddedLabel> page, Under <embeddedLabel>Message Suspension Settings</embeddedLabel>, specify an endpoint where any messages that fail processing are sent to.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can set Transport type to <embeddedLabel>Azure Service Bus</embeddedLabel>, the route destination type to <embeddedLabel>BasicHttpRelay</embeddedLabel>, and then specify a relay endpoint with all the details where a failed message is routed to.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can set Transport type to <embeddedLabel>Azure Service Bus</embeddedLabel>, the route destination type to <embeddedLabel>BasicHttpRelay</embeddedLabel>, and then specify a relay endpoint with all the details where a failed message is routed to.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial does not cover the scenario where a failed message is sent to the endpoint you specify in the <embeddedLabel>Message Suspension Settings</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial does not cover the scenario where a failed message is sent to the endpoint you specify in the <embeddedLabel>Message Suspension Settings</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: However, for successful deployment of the agreement, you must provide a value for this property.
trans-unit.target: However, for successful deployment of the agreement, you must provide a value for this property.

trans-unit.source: You can enter a non-empty value.
trans-unit.target: You can enter a non-empty value.

trans-unit.source: To specify the send settings
trans-unit.target: To specify the send settings

trans-unit.source: On the Send Settings tab, leave the default values for Inbound URL, Transform, and Batching pages.
trans-unit.target: On the Send Settings tab, leave the default values for Inbound URL, Transform, and Batching pages.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel> page, under the <embeddedLabel>Schemas</embeddedLabel> section, specify the following properties.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Protocol</embeddedLabel> page, under the <embeddedLabel>Schemas</embeddedLabel> section, specify the following properties.

trans-unit.source: Version
trans-unit.target: Version

trans-unit.source: Transaction Type (ST1)
trans-unit.target: Transaction Type (ST1)

trans-unit.source: Schema
trans-unit.target: Schema

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> page, specify the endpoints where the response messages or acknowledgements received from the other partner will be sent to.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> page, specify the endpoints where the response messages or acknowledgements received from the other partner will be sent to.

trans-unit.source: You must specify an endpoint each for the messages that are processed successfully as well as the messages that get suspended due to a failure in processing.
trans-unit.target: You must specify an endpoint each for the messages that are processed successfully as well as the messages that get suspended due to a failure in processing.

trans-unit.source: For receiving messages that were successfully processed, under <embeddedLabel>Transport Settings</embeddedLabel> specify the following values:
trans-unit.target: For receiving messages that were successfully processed, under <embeddedLabel>Transport Settings</embeddedLabel> specify the following values:

trans-unit.source: Set <embeddedLabel>Transport type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Azure Service Bus</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Set <embeddedLabel>Transport type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Azure Service Bus</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Set the route destination type to <embeddedLabel>BasicHttpRelay</embeddedLabel>,
trans-unit.target: Set the route destination type to <embeddedLabel>BasicHttpRelay</embeddedLabel>,

trans-unit.source: Specify the <token>sb2</token> namespace, issuer name, and issuer key for the relay endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Specify the <token>sb2</token> namespace, issuer name, and issuer key for the relay endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Specify the relay endpoint as <userInput>Success</userInput> so that the entire URL endpoint is <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>servicebus namespace</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Success</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Specify the relay endpoint as <userInput>Success</userInput> so that the entire URL endpoint is <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>servicebus namespace</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Success</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: For receiving messages that failed processing, under <embeddedLabel>Message Suspension Settings</embeddedLabel> specify the following values:
trans-unit.target: For receiving messages that failed processing, under <embeddedLabel>Message Suspension Settings</embeddedLabel> specify the following values:

trans-unit.source: Set <embeddedLabel>Transport type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Azure Service Bus</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Set <embeddedLabel>Transport type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Azure Service Bus</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Set the route destination type to <embeddedLabel>BasicHttpRelay</embeddedLabel>,
trans-unit.target: Set the route destination type to <embeddedLabel>BasicHttpRelay</embeddedLabel>,

trans-unit.source: Specify the <token>sb2</token> namespace, issuer name, and issuer key for the relay endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Specify the <token>sb2</token> namespace, issuer name, and issuer key for the relay endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Specify the relay endpoint as <userInput>Failure</userInput> so that the entire URL endpoint is <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>servicebus namespace</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Failure</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Specify the relay endpoint as <userInput>Failure</userInput> so that the entire URL endpoint is <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>servicebus namespace</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Failure</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Deploy</embeddedLabel> to deploy the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Deploy</embeddedLabel> to deploy the agreement.

trans-unit.source: The agreement is now deployed at the URL that was displayed in the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> page of the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab.
trans-unit.target: The agreement is now deployed at the URL that was displayed in the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> page of the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab.

trans-unit.source: Typically, the endpoint where the agreement is deployed resembles the following:
trans-unit.target: Typically, the endpoint where the agreement is deployed resembles the following:
